comment: One of my favorite professors ever. He gives really good feedback, projects are fun, and you can tell he genuinely cares about his students. He constantly checks in on each student, making sure they aren't having trouble on projects. Lectures can be long, but you can work while he talks.

Professor Santiago is one of my favorites on campus. I took him both this semester and last semester, and both were wonderful experiences. His critiques are thorough and well balanced- you will know what you did well and what to improve. He's very lenient, and as long as you communicate with him, he will be understanding if you're behind. Take him!

My second semester taking Professor Santiago and he was just as great as the last time. I highly suggest if anything comes up for you during the semester to communicate clearly with him as he can only help you if you communicate. Make sure to pay attention to Storyboard concepts and actively apply them as he is lenient but not naive.

I had no issues with this professor; I wasn't as committed as I should have been with personal stuff but he was incredibly understanding and did the best to help out as much as he can. Please make sure to communicate with him as that is a very important thing for him but when you do, he'll do what he can to help you out to the best of his ability.

He's a good person and made me laugh. He'll teach you what you need to know but get ready for tangents, sometimes it takes him a while before he gets back on topic but I think that just shows that he's personable

He's very understanding if you are new to a program. He will sit and help individual students as needed. If you are not feeling well he'll tell you to go home, no worries. Critiques are long and detailed so be ready for 1-2 class-long critiques, but they are no stress. Also, he's just a great prof to chat with, very chill and funny.

I created my first animatics in this class, which I've always wanted to do. He's a great person and really cares for every student. 5 projects total; 3 are prompt (1 group project) and 2 are self-lead (use to develop senior reel/portfolio piece). He's an easy grader but gives great feedback/ideas. Critique days take a while and last avg 2 days.

While I adore this professor he has poor time management when it comes to critique and giving lessons. Still recommend taking him as his feedback is spectacular. Do be prepared for potentially never having critique on any of your own work.

Really cares about your artistic vision and always gives great pointers how to improve. Bit new to teaching so he's a bit shy, but still does a great job. Didn't find class challenging enough as we had a lot of free reign to complete projects in Photoshop/Illustrator/any program. He's chatty in the good way and very understanding. Most chill class.

Santiago is a true bestie. Hes an amazing professor!! So laid back and wants to help his students as much as possible! He is the sweetest guy to exist and Id highly recommend taking him!! I learned a ton of new things in this class bc of him and he gives you SO many resources and brushes to download and keep forever. Super chill environment :)

Prof. Santiago takes the time to give each individual student thoughtful feedback! He cares about YOUR ideas and doesn't limit you to one type of art style. He's super funny and the last thing he wants you to be is stressed about his class. Also, assignments were super fun!( I took electronic illustration)

My favorite professor ever! He's worked in the industry, and really wants to help you succeed too. I feel like he really cared about every student and graded based on effort and how much you've learned instead of just how good the finished piece was. The critique days were fun and had a positive atmosphere, instead of being something to dread!
